episodeTitle: Brownbeard in Grief! Luffy Lands a Furious Blow!
japanesTitle: 茶ひげ必通! ルフィ怒りの一撃
romanizedTitle: Chahige Hitsū! Rufi Ikari no Ichigeki
description: Brownbeard confronts Caesar Clown about his missing crew, only to learn the horrifying truth that Caesar deliberately left them to die. When Caesar attempts to silence Brownbeard, Luffy arrives and delivers a powerful Haki-infused punch to Caesar's face. Caesar reveals shocking information about SMILE production and connections to Doflamingo and Kaido.

events.title: Zoro Carries Tashigi from Poisonous Gas
events.description: Zoro continues to carry Tashigi away from the deadly Shinokuni poisonous gas that is spreading through Punk Hazard. Despite their rivalry, Zoro ensures her safety.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's protective nature and the ongoing threat of Caesar's poison gas weapon.

events.title: Sanji and G-5 Help Chopper Vaccinate Children
events.description: Sanji and the G-5 Marines continue assisting Chopper in administering sedatives and vaccines to the giant children who have been experimented on by Caesar.
events.significance: Shows the Straw Hats and Marines working together to save innocent children from Caesar's cruel experiments.

events.title: Usopp Discovers Caesar's Surveillance Room
events.description: Usopp finds a door that leads to the room where Caesar Clown and his subordinates are watching the Straw Hats and Marines on surveillance screens.
events.significance: Reveals that Caesar has been monitoring everyone's movements throughout the facility.

events.title: Brownbeard Confronts Caesar About His Crew
events.description: Brownbeard arrives at Building R and confronts Caesar, demanding to know what happened to his crew members who were left outside when the Shinokuni gas was released.
events.significance: Sets up the major betrayal reveal and shows Brownbeard's loyalty to his crew.

quotes.text: What happened to my men outside on the island before Shinokuni was released?!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard desperately seeks answers about his crew

events.title: Caesar Reveals He Left Brownbeard's Crew to Die
events.description: Caesar coldly admits that he received Brownbeard's crew's distress call but deliberately chose to ignore it, leaving them to die in the Shinokuni poison gas. This reveals the true extent of Caesar's callousness and betrayal.
events.significance: Major turning point showing Caesar's complete disregard for his subordinates' lives and his willingness to sacrifice anyone for his experiments.

quotes.text: I received their distress call... but I left them to die outside.
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar reveals his betrayal with complete indifference

events.title: Brownbeard Attempts to Expose Caesar
events.description: Angered by Caesar's betrayal and callous disregard for his crew's lives, Brownbeard tries to reveal Caesar's true villainous nature to his subordinates and warn them about working for him.
events.significance: Brownbeard turns against Caesar and attempts to protect others from suffering the same fate as his crew.

events.title: Caesar Drugs Brownbeard with Muscle Relaxant
events.description: To prevent Brownbeard from exposing him, Caesar injects Brownbeard with a powerful muscle relaxant drug, incapacitating him before he can reveal the truth to others.
events.significance: Shows Caesar's ruthlessness and his willingness to silence anyone who threatens his operations.

events.title: Caesar Orders His Subordinates to Kill Brownbeard
events.description: After drugging Brownbeard, Caesar orders his subordinates to eliminate him. They open fire on the helpless Brownbeard, showing Caesar's complete lack of mercy.
events.significance: Demonstrates the extreme danger Caesar poses and his willingness to murder his own followers.

events.title: Luffy Arrives and Punches Caesar with Haki
events.description: Luffy arrives just in time and delivers a powerful Haki-infused punch to Caesar's face, knocking him away and saving Brownbeard from being killed. This is a pivotal moment showing Luffy's anger at Caesar's cruelty.
events.significance: Major turning point where Luffy directly engages Caesar and demonstrates his Haki can affect Logia users, setting up their eventual battle.

events.title: Caesar Reveals Punk Hazard Is Not Supposed to Exist
events.description: Caesar tells Luffy that Punk Hazard is not supposed to exist and nobody is supposed to know what happens on the island. He reveals that Vergo covers up any information about the island.
events.significance: Major world-building reveal about the conspiracy surrounding Punk Hazard and the involvement of high-ranking Marines in covering up illegal activities.

quotes.text: Punk Hazard is not supposed to exist, and nobody is supposed to know what happens on that island.
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar explains the conspiracy behind the island

events.title: Vergo's Role in Covering Up Punk Hazard Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that Vergo, the head of G-5 Marine base, actively covers up information about Punk Hazard and anything that happens there, explaining how Caesar has been able to operate with impunity.
events.significance: Critical revelation about Marine corruption at the highest levels and Vergo's true role as a traitor working with Caesar and Doflamingo.

events.title: SAD Production and SMILE Devil Fruits Revealed
events.description: Caesar reveals that SAD production is run by Donquixote Doflamingo, and that SAD produces SMILE, artificial Zoan Devil Fruits. This is the first mention of SMILE in the anime.
events.significance: Massive world-building reveal that establishes the existence of artificial Devil Fruits and connects the story to broader conspiracies involving Doflamingo and the underworld.

quotes.text: SAD production is run by Donquixote Doflamingo, and SAD produces SMILE, an artificial Zoan Devil Fruit.
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar explains the true purpose of his research

events.title: SMILE Artificial Devil Fruit Debuts
events.description: The concept of SMILE, artificial Zoan-type Devil Fruits created by Caesar using SAD, is introduced for the first time in the anime. These fruits are being mass-produced for unknown purposes.
events.significance: Introduction of artificial Devil Fruits, a major plot element that will drive much of the story going forward, particularly regarding Kaido's army.

events.title: Connection Between SMILE and an Emperor Hinted
events.description: Caesar taunts Luffy that he will face danger from both Doflamingo and an Emperor if he interferes with the SMILE production, hinting at Kaido's involvement in purchasing the artificial Devil Fruits.
events.significance: First hint of the connection between the SMILE operation and one of the Four Emperors (later revealed to be Kaido), setting up major future storylines.

quotes.text: You'll be in danger from both Doflamingo and an Emperor if you attack me!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar threatens Luffy with powerful enemies

events.title: Luffy Declares He's Been Fighting Powerful Enemies Since the Grand Line
events.description: In response to Caesar's threats about Doflamingo and an Emperor, Luffy punches Caesar again and declares that he has been dealing with people like that since he entered the Grand Line.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's fearlessness and growth, demonstrating he is not intimidated by Warlords or Emperors.

quotes.text: I've been dealing with people like that since I entered the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy responds to Caesar's threats with confidence

quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard confronts Caesar about his crew

themes.description: The episode focuses on Caesar's ultimate betrayal of Brownbeard and his crew, showing the danger of trusting villains and the consequences of blind loyalty.
themes.symbolism: Brownbeard's broken trust represents the danger of following charismatic but evil leaders.

themes.description: Luffy's intervention to save Brownbeard demonstrates his heroic nature and willingness to help even former enemies when they are being wronged.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's punch represents justice delivered to those who abuse their power.

themes.description: The revelation of Vergo's cover-up and the SMILE operation exposes deep corruption within the Marines and the underworld's influence.
themes.symbolism: Punk Hazard as a place that 'doesn't exist' represents hidden evils in the world.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some scenes of the G-5 Marines and Straw Hats running through the facility for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first mention of SMILE artificial Devil Fruits in the anime, a major plot element that drives the Dressrosa and Wano arcs.
Caesar's voice actor Ryūsei Nakao also voiced Frieza in Dragon Ball Z, another villain known for betraying and killing subordinates.
The episode aired with a 6.7% TV rating in Japan and ranked 4th in its time slot.
This episode was released on DVD in the United States on January 5, 2021, nearly 8 years after its original Japanese broadcast.
